column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////We came around 10:30 and they were serving both brunch and lunch. Our favorites were the Citrus French Toast with Goat Cheese
column3: and Buttermilk Fried Chicken with Piri-piri Sauce. The potatoes had a kick (not spicy) and the aioli captured tang and creaminess. The fried chicken wasn't very crispy but was delicious with the cool
column4: also tangy sauce. And spreading goat cheese on french toast--genius! Wasn't a huge fan of the lamb kebabs because it was saltier and drier than I expected.
